article_title: Germanwings Co-Pilot Andreas Lubitz Searched Web on Cockpit Doors
article_text:
DÜSSELDORF, Germany—Andreas Lubitz, the co-pilot suspected of slamming a German passenger jet into a French mountainside last week, killing himself and 149 others, deliberately planned a suicide mission, evidence found by German investigators suggests.

The prosecutor heading the investigation said Thursday that a tablet computer found in Mr. Lubitz’s apartment contained a record of searches for medical treatments, suicide methods and...

twitter.description: Andreas Lubitz was known as neat and enthusiastic, but his long struggle with depression led to Internet searches for suicide methods and cockpit doors just days before he crashed the Airbus A320.
twitter.creator: @berlindiary
